intro: Kozola japonica, commonly known as Japanese kozola, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Kozola japonica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
